FlashMultiPlaneReadInitiate For a Multi-plane read, NAND device needs to queue the planes before transfer data out from the cache register. So each plane is addressed twice, first set of command, send to all planes to queue the data. Second set of command, send again to same planes for actual data out. This requires the Micro code to save the all message data involved in multi-plane operation to issue second set of commands. Due to limited DRAM availability in Micro code it is not possible to store the all message data. FlashMultiPlaneReadInitiate message is sent from the processors to the flash interface to send first set of commands and flashRead message is used to send second set of commands to NAND device. section.title: FlashOpCpl
section.p: This message is used to notify flash operation completion, whether single-plane or multi-plane, from flash interface to the firmware. For flash read requests, when data buffers are allocated by the flash interface, it can only send three data buffer pointers in flashOpCpl message. If the firmware is reading more than three data frames data, and using auto-allocation buffer option, FlashOpCplCOnt is needed.

description.p: This field encodes the completion message type.
This field specifies the index of the Flash completion outbound message queue to be used by this message.
This field encodes the status of the operation:

This bit is set if the percentage of bits in the ECC Chunk prior to LDPC correction that had a value of one was greater than the threshold specified by the erased page ECC chunk threshold (ERASEDTH) field in the ECC Control (ECCCTL) register.

If the status field indicates completion without error, then this field contains the total number poll retries required before it was determined that the flash operation completed. In all other cases, the contents of this field are undefined.
A value of zero in this field indicates that no retries were required and that the Flash device indicated completion the first time it was polled.
Total Number of ECC Bit Errors

If the completion is associated with a Flash read request and the status field indicates completion without error, then this field contains the total number of ECC bit errors that were detected in the flash page. In all other cases, the contents of this field are zero.

If an uncorrectable ECC error was detected in any ECC Chunk, UncErrBitVector contains a bit vector for each potential ECC Chunk. A bit in this vector is set if an uncorrectable error was detected in the corresponding ECC Chunk.

section.title: FlashMemWrite
section.p: The FlashMemWrite message is used to initialize the I-RAM and D_RAM of enabled Flash Channel Processors. This message is processed normal even when the Message Network is disabled(MNDIS) at the Flash Channel Controller end.

description.p: This field must be set to a value of 255 in a flashMemWriterequest message.
Number of DWords contained in the message request
This field specifies the number of valid DWords in this message request. The values zero as well as 13 through 16 are reserved and causes the message to be discarded.

Each bit in this field corresponds to a flash channel processor (i.e., bit zero corresponds to flash channel processor zero, bit one corresponds to flash channel processor one, and son on). When a bit in this field set, the message request is sent to the corresponding Flash channel processor.
This field specifies the starting DWord address location in Flash Channel Processor address space (i.e.,D-Mem or I-Mem) where the data DWords contained in this message are written.
